intro: Harveya pauciflora, commonly known as the mountain orchid, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of South America, particularly in the Andes. It is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, evergreen growth habit. The plant produces small, delicate flowers in shades of white and green, often arranged in a raceme. Harveya pauciflora thrives in cool, moist environments and requires well-drained, nutrient-rich soil. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
